term.title: activator

item.text: A substance, other than the catalyst or one of the substrates, that increases the rate of a catalysed reaction without itself being consumed; the process is called activation. An activator of an enzyme-catalysed reaction may be called enzyme activator, if it acts by binding to the enzyme.

sources.item: PAC, 1993, 65, 2291. 'Nomenclature of kinetic methods of analysis (IUPAC Recommendations 1993)' on page 2292 (https://doi.org/10.1351/pac199365102291)

Users of these terms are encouraged to include the version of a term with its use and to check regularly for updates to term definitions that you are using.
